name: Simple Affiliate Link Checker
author: Digital Solutions Media

sections.description:
Picture this: you have your affiliate website up and running, traffic is on track and increasing, and your content is hitting the target… but then you check your affiliate account balance and nothing seems to change…

We’ve all been there. Broken links can cost you thousands of dollars in revenue! **

Thankfully, Simple Affiliate Link Checker will alert you every time you have a dead affiliate link, so you don’t need to check it yourself while you’re losing time and money!

The plugin will check your links on a regular basis and alert you if there’s any problem with them.
sections.installation:
Installing “Affiliate Link Checker” can be done either by searching for “Affiliate Link Checker” via the “Plugins > Add New” screen in your WordPress dashboard, or by using the following steps:

  1. Download the plugin via WordPress.org
  2. Upload the ZIP file through the ‘Plugins > Add New > Upload’ screen in your WordPress dashboard
  3. Activate the plugin through the ‘Plugins’ menu in WordPress
sections.faq:
What should I use the general settings for?

In this section, you can configure the way you want URLs to be checked.

Methods are the way you want the plugin to We provide the following methods:

  • Exact Match: In case you want to check only one specific URL.
    i.e: https://affiliatelink.com/123456
  • URLs containing: Will check all the URLs that contain the string you include in value. Particularly useful if you have a designated path for your affiliate links.
    i.e: https://yourdomain.com/go/
  • Regex (advanced): If you have a regular expression you would like to create with regex, use this option.
    i.e: (http:\/\/|https:\/\/)?[a-z0-9]+([-.]{1}[a-z0-9]+).[a-z]{2,5}(:[0-9]{1,5})?(\/.)?

If you want to check all your external links, do not include any value.

This plugin template is designed to help you get started with any new WordPress plugin.

What the use of the Notification tab?

In this section you can setup how you want to be notified. Currently, you can be notified via:

  • Slack: See HERE how to setup your slack hook.
  • Email: The email you want to be notified to about broken links.

You can also configure here the frequency of the check.

By default, you’ll only be notified once a day if your links are working. Although, you’ll be notified anytime there’s something wrong with any of your links.

short_description: A plugin that will alert you every time your affiliate links are dead, avoiding the loss of commissions caused by a bad link.
